reviews.text: travel with family from FL to NYC, book this hotel in last minute. We are very happy with the price we got. The hotel is total worth what we paid for. It is luxury hotel, very convenient and comfortable. Big bed, wifi in room.
reviews.title: nice hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at the River Inn for 3 nights and loved it! The staff were helpful, accommodating, funny and went above and beyond.
reviews.title: Perfect.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were clean and very spacious and the hotel itself is in a fantastic location with all attractions close by.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the price we payed, the experience was perfect.
reviews.title: Perfect place to rest after seeing the sites of DC

reviews.text: Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: WoW! Great Location - BIG Rooms- Good Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On up to our room - LARGE, clean, and beds very comfortable that I slept through the entire night. Our view was not so great - we were only on the second floor so ask for a higher up room if you can.
reviews.title: Great price in a great location.

reviews.text: Negatives - I smelled smoke in our room upon arrival. We were assured smoking was not allowed - and it did go away so we assume it was someone in a nearby room or maybe outside (we overlooked the dumpsters). Walls are thin. Hot water had to be on full hot water --Other little things like bathroom door did not shut - all minor that although at first caused panic in me but then by a few hours into our stay really had no major impact rather quirks or things that could be improved.
reviews.title: Lovely Boutique Hotel in the Foggy Bottom Area

reviews.text: A wonderful hotel, quiet, clean and very friendly. The staff were fantastic and very helpful. The rooms are big and comfortable and the added kitchen area is a huge bonus. I stayed here for 5 days during a trip to DC. Great location near the Metro and a lovely area to stay in. I would highly recommend this hotel and hope to stay again in the future.
reviews.title: If your planning a trip to DC you can't go wrong with this hotel.

reviews.text: Ideal autumn weekend in Nation's Capital, glad sister chose this lovely inn, felt like we had our own apartment, and appreciated how close it was to the Kennedy Center, Georgetown, transit, an even a Trader Joe's!
reviews.title: Comfortable, convenient and Cordial.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my second visit to The River Inn. It is a short walk from the Foggy Bottom metro, which in DC is a huge bonus. The neighborhood is filled restaurants and a Whole Foods. There was even a farmers market on Wednesdays. The hotel staff is exemplary - incredibly friendly. The rooms are quite large with a kitchen. The rooms are clean and newly remodeled. The price is exceptional for the amenities and the location. Definitely recommend.
reviews.title: Great Find in a Great Neighborhood

reviews.text: I needed to find a hotel at fairly short notice near George Washington University, and, of course, checked TripAdvisor first. I found many favorable reviews of The River Inn, and also found that there was a special rate offered for the dates I needed. I am very pleased that I made this choice, and will add a very favorable report to the others!
reviews.title: Outstanding boutique hotel in the heart of Foggy Bottom and GWU!

reviews.text: The property has been recently renovated, and the resulting rooms are very lovely - mini-suites with both a Queen bed and sofa bed, restroom and kitchenette with full-size fridge and microwave. An unusual perk, which I have only previously found in a Sydney hotel, was a little coffee grinder and fresh coffee beans, rather than the usual packaged stuff. The bed and pillows are very comfortable; the pillows exceptionally so.
reviews.title: Beautiful Neighbourhood

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As if the location was not enough, the hotel itself was great. Very clean and renovated with a modern feel. The shower head was great, even if the shower itself was a little small. The rooms are huge, especially considering the price. There was a sitting area, a desk, a bathroom, the bedroom, and a kitchen with a stove, microwave, refrigerator, toaster, sink, and coffee maker. Also, there was a coffee grinder and whole bean coffee. Dishes and flatware were supplied as well.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Finally, the staff was very pleasant and helpful all week. They were great with directions and suggestions regarding parking, bars, restaurants, etc. I just can't say enough about this place. For $179 a night, it is a bit too right for my blood, but for the price that we paid, it was perfect.
reviews.title: A Good Find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Last week stayed for three days at this somewhat hidden hotel. Located on a quiet street in a residential area of Washington, D.C. near George Washington University and Georgetown, this boutique hotel is a treasure. All of the hotel staff were warm, friendly, and helpful. The large rooms were equipped with lovely amenities including bath sheets instead of bath towels, a modern shower head which delivered a vigorous stream of water, and a well equipped kitchenette complete with coffee beans, a grinder, and tea bags. In addition, unlike many hotels which charge for bottled water, the room held two complimentary bottles. The hotel restaurant is another hidden gem. The food was delicious and the menu contained some items not commonly found in hotel restaurants.
reviews.title: A true gem, quietly tucked away in the heart of it all

reviews.text: Walking up to the River Inn from the nearby Foggy Bottom Metro station, I was taken aback. You might expect a lovely old building with immaculate grounds, or something chic in a hip neighborhood. Instead, you'll see what looks like a bad Sixties apartment building plunked on a quiet residential street near George Washington University.
reviews.title: Modest exterior, but great value and comfort

reviews.text: My only mild complaint was that the room was a little chilly the first night, and turning on the heat did not help. Upon mentioning this at the front desk, they explained that the central heating had not been turned on, because of a recent warm spell in the city, and they had a small space heater sent up to the room in case the chill continued.
reviews.title: Charming Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The River Inn is located only two blocks from the Foggy Bottom Metro station; exit the station and turn right on the pedestrian extension of "I" street which goes between the GWU Hospital and the Medical School. Cross over the diagonal New Hampshire Avenue, and continue one short block to 25th Street; turn right and the hotel is right there. Very convenient, and easy to reach from Reagan National Airport on the Blue Line Metro.
reviews.title: Great Location, Spacious Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I did not try the restaurant, but prices seem quite reasonable for downtown Washington, DC.
reviews.title: Look No Further!

reviews.text: Our family stayed here for a couple of days to tour Washington. All I can say is that when we come back to Washington, this will be our place to stay again. The rooms have full size kitchens and even though suite was not the separate bedroom the room was large enough to open a full size pull out bed and not feel like we were on top of each other(2 kids, 2 adults) and the room was very clean.the location was perfect, right up the street from the metro, walking distance to the Lincoln Memorial and other monuments. Five minute walk to Georgetown, Kennedy Center and Watergate Hotel. We were in a residential area which made it very quiet but a block away from numerous restaurants and shopping.
reviews.title: Little Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff incredible, when you stay ask for Will he will lead in the right direction whatever type of reasoning your are in washington, He lead to excellent restaurants, directions and the best way to tour washington and get the best bang for your buck. Unfortunately, I can't not remember the young women who assisted us but she had blond her in a cute bob. She had the hook up to the best pizza I have tasted and great with the kids.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The final thing we got an excellant price through Hotels.com and the amount we ended up paying was less than 130 a night and that included valet the car. You can't beat that in Washington.
reviews.title: Surprised by the Amenities - A Keeper

reviews.text: This was a great hotel! Easy to get to and use the Metro - so forget the rental car when in D.C. The hotel was very clean with modern decor in spacious apartment style rooms and comfortable beds. The hotel front desk staff (especially Kacem) was extremely friendly and helpful. We used the free hotel bikes one day to tour all the monuments as well as the river trailway near the hotel. Made for a terrific and enjoyable stay in D.C.
reviews.title: Very nice place to stay in a good location

reviews.text: They were happy we had chosen them as our first trip to D.C. so they actually threw in a bottle of wine (a mini one) and some cookies with a hand written note when we entered our suite. That was just cool! And, our corner suite was super huge, looked out over NW D.C. with awesome sunshine from the evening sun. Nice view from 6 floors up like of the Potomac, Georgetown, and the Watergate. Couldn't have asked for better, seriously, because we love it when we have a cozy couch with big TV in one room, and our bedroom is around the corner and in a separate area. And a kitchen, and a dining table, and modern looking desks, I mean you can't beat this. Oh, but you can: they have bikes which are FREE to guests to pedal around the sites of D.C. They were nice enough to ask us to call them every 2 hours and if no one else was waiting for the bikes, we could keep biking. We ended up using them from 10am to 9pm!! That would have cost a small fortune with the 'Capital Bikeshare' program. We we talking to folks around the Jefferson Memorial about this (they were on the Capital bikes) and they couldn't believe it. Then we told them the price of the suite...they were blown over and were speechless. I'm telling you, the River Inn is one heck of nice place to stay in D.C. Trader Joe's is just a block and a half away. The Foggy Bottom Metro is just a block and half away. Georgetown's M street restaurants are way cool and a short bike ride away down K street. So is Kayaking. The whole staff is incredible. The rooms are clean and modern. Why WOULDN'T you stay here? I sure will, let me tell you. The best deal in town. (I'm from N.H.)
reviews.title: The River Inn, Washington DC

reviews.text: My family ( wife and two kids) planned an overnight in DC to coincide with a birthday dinner. We wanted to be near the national mall ( on the Lincoln Memorial end) and explored several options around the White House and along Pennsylvania Avenue. Because it was a special occasion, we considered splurging a bit and briefly considered suites ranging from $475-$1000/night at places like The Willard, St. Regis, Mayflower, Four Seasons, etc.
reviews.title: a nice overnight in Foggy Bottom

reviews.text: In doing a search for hotels close to national mall, The River Inn came up. It was hard to resist. The rate was fantastic: $144 for a one-bedroom suite with sofa bed and full sized kitchen. I know the city pretty well, but the hotel is a little hard to find if you aren't familiar with the GWU and Foggy Bottom neighborhood. It's on a residential block and I suspect was once an apartment building. I imagine that their clientele is primarily older professionals and international visitors for extended stays. But I would recommend it for families who like the city noise reduced at bedtime. Its a quiet street and just walking distance away from the bustle of K Street and the GWU campus nightlife.
reviews.title: A hidden gem!

reviews.text: We arrived around 4PM. No greeting at the front door, but the front desk was friendly and efficient. Their valet parking fee is $40. Our room was on the second floor corner and was as described on the website. It was the length of that side of the building and nicely furnished. The woods have some nicks and scratches in them, but everything was sturdy and comfortable. The kitchen was indeed full sized ( with old but functional appliances ) and would have been useful were we staying for several days. The bathroom and bedroom were very large, as well, and we had a good night's rest. The HVAC system is old and noisy. Our stay was on one of the warmer days this month, so we tried to use the A/C, but even when set to 60 ( as an extreme) it never got the room cooler. The windows do open, however, and the room was only mildly uncomfortable.
reviews.title: Great small hotel near GW.
Cute, casual, affordable
reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again. The River Inn seems like it would make a great "secret" alternative to the usual suspect chain hotels if you wanted to stay in the city around during events or holidays.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a small hotel on a picturesque tree lined street within an easy 20 min walk to the monuments.
reviews.title: The River Inn: A great place to stay in Foggy Bottom

reviews.text: Love the room, lots of space with a sitting area, writing desk, vanity corner, kitchenette (which loved so much). The room was so comfy, we had to tear ourselves out of the room to see DC sights. Very nice quiet street, but yet so near to Foggy Bottom Metro station. It's a pleasant difference from the normal hotels. Checking in and out was so efficient, it took no more than 3 mins! I am so glad to have chosen this hotel for our once in a lifetime visit!!!
reviews.title: Lovely stay!
Wonderful
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the River Inn for three nights at the beginning of May. We both were very pleased with the accommodations and the service. Upon arrival a valet immediately helped us unload our luggage and then parked the car for us. After we checked in, which was very speedy, the valet transported our luggage to our room on the eighth floor, Room 801.

Our suite was a corporate suite, and it was very large and roomy. The photos and descriptions on the River Inn's website are accurate. The room had a comfortable queen bed, a sofa, an armoire with a TV, a desk, a lounge chair, an eating table, and two chairs. The furnishings were clean and contemporary. The kitchenette was amply stocked with pots, pans, plates, etc., a two-burner gas stove, a refrigerator, a microwave, a sink, and a coffee machine. The bathroom was a nice size, and the room had a separate dressing area with a granite countertop and plush ottoman. I also highly recommend Room 801 for its nice view. Some rooms in the hotel face another building next door, but we could see the Potomac River from our suite. Nice view.
reviews.title: Very satisfied, some minor complaints

reviews.text: Since we were tourists in D.C., we bought the hotel's "See D.C." Package. At check-in we were given two all-day Metro passes, two adult passes on the Old Town Trolley Tours (worth $32 apiece), coupons for free continental breakfast each day, a disposable camera, and several brochures about D.C. attractions. Also, purchasing this package gave us half-price parking at the hotel ($10 per day instead of the regular price of $20). The conveniece of having the Metro and Trolley tickets given to us at check-in was very nice, and we enjoyed the Trolley tour very much.
reviews.title: Huge disappointment!
Absolutely Fabulous place to stay
reviews.text: The River Inn is located on a residential street, so it's quiet at night. The hotel is very convenient to the Metro, with the Foggy Bottom/GWU stop only two blocks away. On our first morning out we walked to the Lincoln Memorial in less than 20 minutes. I would definitely stay here again and highly recommend this hotel.
